messages.subject: Re: Reading, Was Tampa & Intro
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/5/99 2:34:56 PM !!!First Boot!!!, bushla@home.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/5/99 2:34:56 PM !!!First Boot!!!, bushla@... writes:

<< Her
> favorite thing to write is "I love u". Any suggestions?

Just keep on answering her questions! She's working it out; she'll let you
know what she needs from you. Keep on reading to her, and take your cues
from her, and she'll do fine.
>>


What a wonderful message for her to write! Does she have lots of magnetic
letters and washable markers and a white board and tons of paper to practice
on and sometimes the sandbox with a stick is great too. She soudns like
she's doing great!

Nance

messages.subject: Re: Reading, Was Tampa & Intro
messages.msgSnippet: ... From:  To:  Sent: Saturday, June 05, 1999 12:36 AM Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tampa & Intro ...
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: <wrapyourbaby@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>
Sent: Saturday, June 05, 1999 12:36 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tampa & Intro


> From: wrapyourbaby@...
>
> I'm wondering about what to do with Abby, as far as reading
> goes...she seems like she wants to read, but she hates it when I
> try to instruct her. She gets upset and starts drifting. But, on her
> own, she'll write down letters and ask me what they say. Her
> favorite thing to write is "I love u". Any suggestions?

Just keep on answering her questions! She's working it out; she'll let you
know what she needs from you. Keep on reading to her, and take your cues
from her, and she'll do fine.

Laura Bush
laura@...
http://www.honeypot-hollow.com
